ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]A quick review of eight different mechs that are as much a treat for your ears as your fingers.

ns2:group.ns2:title: A quick review of eight different mechs that are as much a treat for your ears as your fingers.
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Weâ€™re living in a golden age of affordable mechanical keyboards. Boards with great features, nice typing feel, and satisfying sounds can now be had pre-built for just $100-ish instead of the $300-plus they used to run. Here's a quick review of eight different mechs that are as much a treat for your ears as your fingers.
Keyboards covered: Keychron V1 Max Wobkey Rainy 75 Pro Epomaker P75 Chilkey ND75 LP Dry Studio Ice Ring 63 RT Chilkey Slice75 HE Evoworks Evo80 Meletrix Zoom75 Tiga

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]This city just got a new (huge) neighbor! #TEDTalks

ns2:group.ns2:title: This city just got a new (huge) neighbor! #TEDTalks
ns2:group.ns2:description: How does a city change when its art doesnâ€™t hang on museum walls but instead roams the streets? Artist FrÃ©dette Lampre of the production company La Machine shares how their towering, handcrafted mechanical creations transform urban spaces into living theaters, creating unforgettable experiences that reconnect people with their cities and each other.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Epsilon Transforms Marketing Campaigns with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Epsilon Transforms Marketing Campaigns with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Description: See how Epsilon, a subsidiary of Publicis Groupe, enhanced their marketing campaign automation using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Learn how they deployed an AI-powered campaign orchestration system that reduced setup time by 30%, increased personalization capacity by 20%, and scaled campaign creation by 20% while saving teams 8 hours per week.
Discover how AgentCore's comprehensive suite of services enabled Epsilon to automate content creation, campaign design, and real-time optimization across multiple channels, setting new standards for AI-driven customer engagement.
Learn more: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: https://go.aws/4nJmvrP AgentCore Documentation: https://go.aws/48r5w8K Getting started with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: https://go.aws/473vtZC AgentCore Resources: https://go.aws/473E9iG

We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]Will Climate Change Make Your Home Uninsurable? | Amy Barnes | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: Will Climate Change Make Your Home Uninsurable? | Amy Barnes | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Insurance is the hidden engine that keeps the economy churning, but climate change is making home insurance unaffordable for many people, says climate risk advisor Amy Barnes. She reveals why soaring premiums aren't just bad news for homeowners, but also a flashing red signal for the global financial system â€” and why investing in resilience now could change everything. (Recorded at TED Countdown Summit 2025 on June 17, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Will's Vision | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Will's Vision | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Meet Will Horn, founder of global business needs agency (gdna), who is reshaping how companies think about early career talent in the AI era. After discovering Brian Rowe's AWS cloud learning journey https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6TeYwoDgaBA, Will saw an opportunity to create meaningful pathways for emerging tech professionals.
In this executive perspective from our "Beyond the First Build" series, Will shares insights about how AI is transforming entry-level tech roles and why investing in early career talent is crucial for innovation. Learn about gdna's unique approach to developing new builders and hear Will's vision for the future of tech careers.
Watch as Will discusses the evolving technology landscape, the importance of creating psychological safety for learning, and how companies can build successful early career talent programs in the age of AI.
Watch Brian's journey at gdna: https://youtu.be/lgWftKUWdfw

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Deepti's Path to AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Deepti's Path to AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this inspiring follow-up story, we revisit Deepti Trivedi, who we first met as an Associate Technology Strategist exploring cloud computing opportunities [link to previous video]. Since then, Deepti has advanced her career to become a Support Engineer at AWS, where she helps organizations solve complex technical challenges.
Watch as Deepti shares insights about her technical evolution, career transitions, and the continuous learning mindset that drives her success. Learn how she navigates the dynamic world of cloud computing and hear her advice for others considering a career in tech.
This video is part of our "Beyond the First Build" series, showcasing how cloud skills can lead to dynamic career opportunities and meaningful professional growth. Join us as we explore Deepti's journey of continuous learning and achievement in the tech industry.
Watch Deepti's original story: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vaPnGlvfMv0

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Brian's Tech Journey | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Brian's Tech Journey | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this inspiring follow-up story, we revisit Brian Rowe, who we first met during his cloud learning journey with AWS Educate. Since then, Brian's dedication to building cloud skills has led to remarkable opportunities, including an internship that evolved into a full-time role as a Business Catalyst at global business needs agency (gdna).
Watch as Brian shares how his initial steps in cloud computing opened doors to a meaningful tech career, transforming challenges into opportunities. Learn how he applies his technical knowledge in business-focused roles, and hear his advice for others who might think a career in tech is out of reach.
This video is part of our "Beyond the First Build" series, showcasing how cloud skills can lead to dynamic career opportunities and meaningful professional growth. Join us as we explore Brian's continued journey of resilience, learning, and success in the tech industry.
Watch Brian's original story: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6TeYwoDgaBA

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [OpenAI]OpenAI x Broadcom â€” The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 8

ns2:group.ns2:title: OpenAI x Broadcom â€” The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 8
ns2:group.ns2:description:
OpenAI and Broadcom are teaming up to design our own chipsâ€”bringing lessons from building frontier models straight into the hardware. In partnership with Broadcom and alongside our other partners, weâ€™re creating the next generation of AI infrastructure to meet the worldâ€™s growing demand.
In this episode, OpenAIâ€™s Sam Altman and Greg Brockman sit down with Broadcomâ€™s Hock Tan and Charlie Kawwas to announce a new partnership focused on custom AI chips and systems that could redefine whatâ€™s possible in computing.
Chapters 00:00 Announcing the partnership 03:06 The scale of AI infrastructure 06:03 Collaboration and innovation in chip design 08:49 Historical context and future vision 12:10 Role of compute in AI development 15:01 Optimizing for specific workloads 18:02 Journey towards AGI 21:00 Future of AI and compute capacity 23:50 Wrap-up and future projects

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Link Between Evolution and Language | Richard Dawkins | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Link Between Evolution and Language | Richard Dawkins | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Languages drift, adapt and evolve much like living species. In this wide-ranging conversation, evolutionary biologist Richard Dawkins and linguist John McWhorter trace the parallels between biology and speech, from random mutations to cultural selection. They show how both genes and words change, survive and connect us â€” illuminating the deep patterns that shape life and language alike. (Recorded at TED2025 on April 8, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]How BlackBerry Messenger lost the messaging wars | Version History

ns2:group.ns2:title: How BlackBerry Messenger lost the messaging wars | Version History
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Back when text messages cost 10 cents each, BlackBerry came up with a better way: BlackBerry Messenger, commonly known as BBM. It was the first new idea about messaging in a long time, and it was a huge hitâ€¦ for a while. Nilay Patel and Joanna Stern join David Pierce to talk about a messaging service that was years ahead of WhatsApp and iMessage, but ultimately fizzled. #VersionHistory #Podcast #Technology
0:00 The Rise of Text Messaging Costs in 2005 00:31 Introduction to BBM: A Game Changer 00:58 The Nostalgia of Early 2000s Phones 01:30 The Blackberry Era: A Cultural Phenomenon 02:01 The Birth of BBM: Revolutionizing Messaging 05:06 The Instant Messaging Boom of 2005 10:34 The Technical Backbone of Blackberry 12:53 BBM's Unique Features and Rapid Growth 26:41 The Decline of Blackberry and Rise of Competitors 30:25 BBM's Last Stand: Attempts to Save Blackberry 31:10 The Rise and Fall of BBM's Super App Vision 32:30 The Stickiness of Messaging Apps and the iPhone's Impact 33:49 WhatsApp's Emergence and BBM's Missed Opportunities 36:22 The 2011 BBM Outage and Its Aftermath 37:25 BBM's Last Stand and the 2013 Spin-Off Attempt 39:10 The Decline of BBM and the Rise of WhatsApp 41:13 Reflecting on BBM's Legacy and Missed Potential 42:27 Version History Questions: BBM's Best and Worst Features 49:08 Could BBM Have Been Saved? 58:24 Final Thoughts and Conclusion

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]TED Talks Daily Book Club: A Little Daylight Left | Sarah Kay | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: TED Talks Daily Book Club: A Little Daylight Left | Sarah Kay | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Sarah Kay is a spoken word poet and the author of the new poetry collection "A Little Daylight Left." In this TED Talks Daily Book Club interview with host Elise Hu, Kay reflects on her relationship with poetry â€” from reading the poems her parents left in her lunchbox to frequenting the local dive barâ€™s weekly poetry slam to becoming an â€œaccidental ambassadorâ€ of spoken word. She also talks about how she uses different artistic mediums to invite others into poetry, showing how the art form can open you to community, healing and vulnerability.
The TED Talks Daily Book Club series features TED speakers discussing their latest books and exploring their ideas beyond the page. Stay tuned to our feed for more interviews like this one and for special live book club events open exclusively to TED members. (Recorded at A TED Original Podcast on June 3, 2025
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters

The TED Talks channel features talks, performances and original series from the world's leading thinkers and doers. Subscribe to our channel for videos on Technology, Entertainment and Design â€” plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more. Visit https://TED.com to get our entire library of TED Talks, transcripts, translations, personalized talk recommendations and more.
Watch more: https://go.ted.com/sarahkay25
https://youtu.be/V2H3M_0i1Fo
